storyTitle: As Employee, I want to view my daily schedule to plan my workday effectively

testCases.title: Validate successful display of daily schedule
preconditions: Employee has valid login credentials
Employee has at least one shift scheduled for the current day
Web portal is accessible and operational
Database contains valid schedule data for the employee
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the web portal login page using a supported browser
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password fields

steps.action: Enter valid employee credentials (username and password) and click the Login button
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully authenticated and redirected to the dashboard page

steps.action: Verify the dashboard is fully loaded and displays navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard is displayed with all navigation options visible including schedule section

steps.action: Click on the 'Schedule' section from the navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Schedule section opens and displays view options (daily, weekly)

steps.action: Select 'Daily View' option
steps.expectedResult: Daily schedule for the current day is displayed within 3 seconds showing the date header

steps.action: Review the displayed shift details including shift start time, shift end time, location, and role
steps.expectedResult: All shift information is correctly displayed: shift times are in proper format (HH:MM AM/PM), location name is visible, and assigned role is shown accurately matching the database records

steps.action: Verify the page layout and readability of schedule information
steps.expectedResult: Schedule is displayed in a clear, organized format with proper spacing and readable fonts

postconditions: Employee remains logged into the system
Daily schedule view remains active and accessible
No errors are logged in the system
Session remains valid for continued use

testCases.title: Verify navigation to previous and next days
preconditions: Employee is logged into the web portal
Employee is on the daily schedule view page
Current day schedule is displayed
Schedule data exists for previous and next days
Navigation buttons are visible and enabled

steps.action: Verify the current date is displayed in the schedule header
steps.expectedResult: Current date is clearly shown in the header (e.g., 'Monday, January 15, 2024')

steps.action: Locate and click the 'Next Day' button or right arrow navigation control
steps.expectedResult: Page refreshes or updates smoothly and displays the schedule for the next day (e.g., 'Tuesday, January 16, 2024')

steps.action: Verify the date header has updated to show the next day's date
steps.expectedResult: Date header displays the correct next day date and any scheduled shifts for that day are shown

steps.action: Review the shift details for the next day
steps.expectedResult: Shift information for the next day is displayed correctly with accurate times, location, and role

steps.action: Click the 'Previous Day' button or left arrow navigation control
steps.expectedResult: Page updates and displays the schedule for the previous day (returning to current day)

steps.action: Verify the date header has updated to show the previous day's date
steps.expectedResult: Date header displays the correct previous day date and original schedule is restored

steps.action: Click 'Previous Day' button again to navigate to the day before current day
steps.expectedResult: Schedule for the day before current day is displayed with correct date and shift information

steps.action: Verify no errors occur during navigation and page load time remains under 3 seconds for each navigation action
steps.expectedResult: All navigation actions complete successfully within performance requirements without error messages

postconditions: Employee can continue navigating between days
System maintains session state
Navigation history is maintained
No data corruption or display errors occur

testCases.title: Ensure access is restricted to authenticated employees
preconditions: Web portal is accessible
Daily schedule URL endpoint is known
Test user has valid employee credentials available
Browser session has no active authentication tokens
Security and authentication services are operational

steps.action: Open a new browser window or incognito/private browsing session
steps.expectedResult: New browser session opens with no cached credentials or active sessions

steps.action: Directly navigate to the daily schedule URL (e.g., https://portal.company.com/schedules/daily) without logging in
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied and user is redirected to the login page or an access denied page is displayed

steps.action: Verify that an appropriate error message is displayed
steps.expectedResult: User-friendly error message is shown such as 'Access Denied: Please log in to view your schedule' or 'Authentication Required'

steps.action: Verify that no schedule data is visible or accessible in the page source or network responses
steps.expectedResult: No sensitive schedule information is exposed; API returns 401 Unauthorized or 403 Forbidden status

steps.action: Navigate to the login page and enter valid employee credentials
steps.expectedResult: Login form accepts credentials and authentication process initiates

steps.action: Click the Login button to authenticate
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully authenticated and redirected to the dashboard or daily schedule page

steps.action: Verify that the daily schedule is now accessible and displays correctly
steps.expectedResult: Daily schedule page loads successfully within 3 seconds showing complete schedule information with shift times, location, and role

steps.action: Verify the authentication token is present in the session
steps.expectedResult: Valid OAuth 2.0 token is stored in session and used for API requests

postconditions: Authenticated employee has full access to daily schedule
Security logs record the unauthorized access attempt
Session is established and valid for the authenticated user
System maintains proper access control for subsequent requests

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to view my weekly schedule to plan my workweek efficiently

testCases.title: Validate display of weekly schedule
preconditions: Employee has valid login credentials
Employee has shifts scheduled for the current week
Web portal is accessible and operational
Database contains valid weekly schedule data
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the web portal login page using a supported browser (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, or Edge)
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password input fields and login button

steps.action: Enter valid employee credentials (username and password) and click the Login button
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully authenticated and redirected to the dashboard page

steps.action: Verify the dashboard loads completely with all navigation elements visible
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard is displayed with navigation menu including schedule section and all UI elements are rendered properly

steps.action: Click on the 'Schedule' section from the navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Schedule section opens displaying available view options (daily view and weekly view)

steps.action: Select 'Weekly View' or 'Weekly Schedule' option
steps.expectedResult: Weekly schedule view loads within 4 seconds displaying a 7-day calendar grid for the current week

steps.action: Verify the week date range is displayed in the header (e.g., 'January 15 - January 21, 2024')
steps.expectedResult: Week date range is clearly shown in the header indicating the start and end dates of the displayed week

steps.action: Verify all 7 days of the week are displayed (Sunday through Saturday or Monday through Sunday based on configuration)
steps.expectedResult: All 7 days are shown in the weekly view with day names and dates clearly labeled

steps.action: Review shifts for each day of the week, checking Monday's schedule
steps.expectedResult: Monday's shifts are displayed with complete details including shift start time, end time, location, and role assignment

steps.action: Review shifts for Tuesday through Sunday, verifying each day's schedule information
steps.expectedResult: All shifts for each day of the week are correctly displayed with accurate shift times, location names, and role assignments matching database records

steps.action: Verify that days with no scheduled shifts display appropriately (e.g., 'No shifts scheduled' or empty state)
steps.expectedResult: Days without shifts show a clear indication such as 'No shifts' or 'Day off' rather than appearing broken or empty

steps.action: Verify the current day is highlighted or visually distinguished from other days
steps.expectedResult: Current day is highlighted with a different background color, border, or visual indicator making it easily identifiable

postconditions: Employee remains logged into the system
Weekly schedule view remains active and accessible
No errors are logged in the system
Session remains valid for continued navigation

testCases.title: Verify navigation between weeks
preconditions: Employee is logged into the web portal
Employee is on the weekly schedule view page
Current week schedule is displayed
Schedule data exists for previous and next weeks
Week navigation buttons are visible and enabled

steps.action: Verify the current week date range is displayed in the header
steps.expectedResult: Current week date range is clearly shown (e.g., 'January 15 - January 21, 2024')

steps.action: Note the shifts displayed for the current week for comparison after navigation
steps.expectedResult: Current week's schedule is visible with all shift details for reference

steps.action: Locate and click the 'Next Week' button or right arrow navigation control
steps.expectedResult: Page updates smoothly and displays the schedule for the next week with updated date range in header

steps.action: Verify the week date range header has updated to show next week's dates (e.g., 'January 22 - January 28, 2024')
steps.expectedResult: Date range header displays the correct next week dates spanning 7 consecutive days

steps.action: Review the shifts displayed for the next week
steps.expectedResult: All shifts for the next week are displayed correctly with accurate times, locations, and roles for each day

steps.action: Verify the page load time is within 4 seconds
steps.expectedResult: Weekly schedule for next week loads completely within the 4-second performance requirement

steps.action: Click the 'Previous Week' button or left arrow navigation control
steps.expectedResult: Page updates and displays the schedule for the previous week (returning to current week)

steps.action: Verify the week date range has updated back to the current week dates
steps.expectedResult: Date range header displays the original current week dates and the original schedule is restored

steps.action: Verify the shifts match the originally displayed current week schedule
steps.expectedResult: All shift information matches the initial current week display confirming accurate navigation

steps.action: Click 'Previous Week' button again to navigate to the week before current week
steps.expectedResult: Schedule for the previous week is displayed with correct date range and shift information

steps.action: Verify the week date range shows dates prior to the current week
steps.expectedResult: Date range header displays the correct previous week dates (e.g., 'January 8 - January 14, 2024')

steps.action: Verify no errors occur during any navigation action and all transitions are smooth
steps.expectedResult: All navigation actions complete successfully without error messages, broken layouts, or performance degradation

postconditions: Employee can continue navigating between weeks
System maintains session state
Navigation history is preserved
No data corruption or display errors occur
Current day highlighting updates appropriately when navigating to weeks containing current date

testCases.title: Ensure access control for weekly schedule
preconditions: Web portal is accessible
Weekly schedule URL endpoint is known
Test user has valid employee credentials available
Browser session has no active authentication tokens
Security and authentication services are operational

steps.action: Open a new browser window or incognito/private browsing session to ensure no cached credentials
steps.expectedResult: New browser session opens with no stored authentication data or active sessions

steps.action: Directly navigate to the weekly schedule URL (e.g., https://portal.company.com/schedules/weekly) without logging in
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied and user is automatically redirected to the login page or an access denied error page is displayed

steps.action: Verify that an appropriate access denied or authentication required message is displayed
steps.expectedResult: User-friendly error message is shown such as 'Access Denied: Authentication Required' or 'Please log in to view your weekly schedule'

steps.action: Open browser developer tools and check the network tab for API responses
steps.expectedResult: API request to GET /api/schedules/weekly returns 401 Unauthorized or 403 Forbidden status code

steps.action: Verify that no schedule data is visible in the page content or accessible in the page source code
steps.expectedResult: No sensitive schedule information is exposed; page shows only error message or login prompt without any schedule data

steps.action: Navigate to the login page (if not already redirected) and locate the username and password fields
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with input fields for credentials and a login button

steps.action: Enter valid employee credentials (username and password)
steps.expectedResult: Credentials are accepted in the input fields without validation errors

steps.action: Click the Login button to authenticate
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully authenticated via OAuth 2.0 and redirected to the dashboard or weekly schedule page

steps.action: Verify that the weekly schedule is now accessible and displays correctly
steps.expectedResult: Weekly schedule page loads successfully within 4 seconds showing the complete 7-day schedule with all shift details including times, locations, and roles

steps.action: Verify the authentication token is present and valid in the session
steps.expectedResult: Valid OAuth 2.0 authentication token is stored in the session and included in API request headers

steps.action: Check the network tab to confirm API request now returns 200 OK status
steps.expectedResult: GET /api/schedules/weekly request returns 200 OK status with schedule data in response body

postconditions: Authenticated employee has full access to weekly schedule
Security logs record the unauthorized access attempt and subsequent successful authentication
Valid session is established for the authenticated user
System maintains proper access control and authorization for all subsequent requests
Employee can navigate to other schedule views and features

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to export my schedule to PDF to have an offline copy

testCases.title: Validate successful PDF export of schedule
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system
Employee has an active schedule with assigned shifts
Employee has access to the schedule view page
Browser has download permissions enabled
PDF generation service is operational

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule page and select daily view
steps.expectedResult: Schedule is displayed in daily view showing all shifts for the selected day with times, locations, and roles

steps.action: Click the 'Export to PDF' button
steps.expectedResult: System initiates PDF generation process and displays a loading indicator

steps.action: Wait for PDF generation to complete
steps.expectedResult: PDF is generated and download link is provided within 5 seconds, loading indicator disappears

steps.action: Click the download link to save the PDF file
steps.expectedResult: PDF file downloads successfully to the default download location

steps.action: Open the downloaded PDF file using a PDF reader
steps.expectedResult: PDF opens successfully and displays the schedule in daily view format

steps.action: Verify all shift details in the PDF including shift times, locations, and assigned roles
steps.expectedResult: PDF contains accurate and complete schedule details matching the web view, all text is readable and properly formatted

steps.action: Return to schedule page and switch to weekly view
steps.expectedResult: Schedule is displayed in weekly view showing all shifts for the selected week

steps.action: Click the 'Export to PDF' button for weekly view
steps.expectedResult: PDF is generated and download link is provided within 5 seconds

steps.action: Download and open the weekly view PDF
steps.expectedResult: PDF contains accurate weekly schedule with all shift details properly formatted

steps.action: Return to schedule page and switch to monthly view
steps.expectedResult: Schedule is displayed in monthly view showing all shifts for the selected month

steps.action: Click the 'Export to PDF' button for monthly view
steps.expectedResult: PDF is generated and download link is provided within 5 seconds

steps.action: Download and open the monthly view PDF
steps.expectedResult: PDF contains accurate monthly schedule with all shift details properly formatted and readable

postconditions: Three PDF files (daily, weekly, monthly) are successfully downloaded
All PDFs contain accurate schedule information
Employee remains logged in and on the schedule page
No error messages are displayed
System is ready for additional export operations

testCases.title: Verify error handling during export
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system
Employee has access to the schedule view page
Test environment allows simulation of backend failures
PDF generation service can be toggled or simulated to fail

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule page and verify schedule is displayed
steps.expectedResult: Schedule page loads successfully with current schedule view displayed

steps.action: Configure test environment to simulate PDF generation service failure
steps.expectedResult: Backend PDF generation service is set to return an error response

steps.action: Click the 'Export to PDF' button
steps.expectedResult: System attempts to generate PDF and initiates the export request

steps.action: Observe the system response after backend failure
steps.expectedResult: User-friendly error message is displayed such as 'Unable to generate PDF. Please try again later.' or 'PDF export failed. Please contact support if the issue persists.'

steps.action: Verify that the error message does not expose technical details or stack traces
steps.expectedResult: Error message is clear, non-technical, and appropriate for end users

steps.action: Verify that the schedule page remains functional after the error
steps.expectedResult: Schedule view is still accessible and all other functionality works normally

steps.action: Check that no partial or corrupted PDF file was downloaded
steps.expectedResult: No file download occurred, download folder does not contain any incomplete PDF files

steps.action: Restore PDF generation service to normal operation
steps.expectedResult: Backend service is functioning normally again

steps.action: Click the 'Export to PDF' button again
steps.expectedResult: PDF is generated successfully and download link is provided, confirming system recovery

postconditions: User-friendly error message was displayed during failure
No corrupted or partial files were downloaded
Schedule page functionality remains intact
System successfully recovers and can perform exports after service restoration
Error is logged appropriately for troubleshooting
